Package net.silthus.schat.identity

Interface Identity

All Superinterfaces:
Pointered
public sealed interface Identity extends Pointered
An identity is an object identified by its unique id.

The identity can optionally hold a name() and displayName().

No other class is allowed to extend identity. The Identified interface must be used instead and point the Identified.identity() to an instance of this class.

No null reference to an identity should be used. Use the nil() object instead.

Since:
next

  • Method Details

    • nil

      @NotNull static @NotNull Identity nil()
      Gets a nil identity.

      The identity will have an empty name() and displayName(), but no properties will actual be null.

      The uniqueId() of the nil identity will always be the same during the lifetime of the application, but changes for every lifecycle.

      Returns:
      the nil identity
      Since:
      next

    • identity

      static Identity identity(@NonNull @NonNull UUID id)
      Creates a new identity using the provided id.

      The name of the identity will be empty, but not null.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the identity

    • identity

      @NotNull static @NotNull Identity identity(@NonNull @NonNull String name)
      Creates a new identity using the provided name.

      A random UUID will be used for the id and the displayName() will be the name.

      Parameters:
      name - the name
      Returns:
      the identity

    • displayName

      default net.kyori.adventure.text.Component displayName()
      Gets the display name of the identity.

      Defaults to a Component.empty() if the identity has no display name. The name() is used if the identity has one.

      Returns:
      the display name
